intro: Grewia zizyphifolia, commonly known as the sour plum or wild sour plum, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are typically ovate to elliptic in shape. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by small, fleshy, red or orange berries. These berries are edible and have a tart flavor, often used in local cuisines and traditional medicine. Grewia zizyphifolia thrives in well-drained soils and is commonly found in savanna and woodland habitats.
